attributes.title: Upanishad - Live Forever Blissfully
attributes.description:
Today’s (6th February, 2015) Morning Satsang continues with the Upanishads Series - Living Advaita.

Isha Upanishad–Verse 2

kurvann eveha karmāṇi
jijīviṣec chataṁ samāḥ|
evaṁ tvayi nānyatheto ‘sti
na karma lipyate nare || 2 ||


In this profound delivery of the Isha Upanishad, Paramahamsa Nithyananda begins the second Verse and declares: Upanishads is THE principle book for Hinduism, our Sangha and the whole of humanity. And the ultimate, lifestyle book, that was delivered by Mahadeva to Parvati, is the Kamika Agama. He sums up the Vedic Tradition in just one word and that is Live!




TRANSCRIPTS:-

I will directly enter into the Upanishads.
 
Today, I will enter into the second verse. Please chant along with me.
 
कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेच्छत्ग्ण् समाः |
एवं त्वयि नान्यथेतोऽस्ति न कर्म लिप्यते नरे ॥
kurvanneveha karmaaNi jijeeviShechChathgN^ samaaH |
evaM thvayi naanyaThethoaAsthi na karma lipyathe nare ||
 
The translation says:
 
“Even while doing deeds here, one may desire to live a hundred years, Thus, on you, not otherwise, that this is it, the deed adheres, not the man.”
 
Listen! This verse is the essence of Vedic Tradition. Again and again and again insists, Vedic Tradition is all FOR LIFE! If I have to put the whole Vedic Tradition in one word: LIVE!  That’s all! LIVE! Live so powerfully, so clearly, that all your patterns, engrams, fears, don’t find any place; you are just radiating; you are just overflowing.  LIVE!  LIVE!  LIVE!
 
कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेच्छत्ग्ण् समाः |
एवं त्वयि नान्यथेतोऽस्ति न कर्म लिप्यते नरे ॥
kurvanneveha karmaaNi jijeeviShechChathgN^ samaaH |
evaM thvayi naanyaThethoaAsthi na karma lipyathe nare ||
 
This verse is actually a “blessing”. See, the Upanishadic rishis expect you to achieve everything just by the first verse: 
 
ईशावास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत् ।
तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम् ॥ 1 ॥
Eeshaavaasyamidham Sarvam Yathkincha Jagathyaam Jagath |
Thena Thyakthena Bhunjeethaa Maa Gridhah Kasyasviddhanam ||
 
Over!  They don’t expect you to have any doubt. The kind of a space they are carrying, rishis feel with this verse you are enlightened! Now you just need a blessing. A disciple who is enlightened needs the blessing from the guru. Actually, this verse –
 
कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेच्छत्ग्ण् समाः |
एवं त्वयि नान्यथेतोऽस्ति न कर्म लिप्यते नरे ॥
kurvanneveha karmaaNi jijeeviShechChathgN^ samaaH |
evaM thvayi naanyaThethoaAsthi na karma lipyathe nare ||
 
this verse is a “blessing”. 
 
Somebody was telling me the other day..... One Swami came and met me. That Swami was telling me, he heard some of the great scholars, pundits, telling him....it seems they asked this Swami who came to meet me, ‘What right this Nithyananda has to comment on Upanishads? Where has he studied Sanskrit Who is his guru teaching all the bhaashyaas? Who taught all the bhaashyaas?’, all these scholarly questions! Scholarly questions! 
 
This Swami, it seems, asked only one question, ‘I am also seeing his satsangh. You are also seeing his satsangh. Come on, let us have an open discussion. Tell me honestly, all his words, does it make sense or not?’
 
It seems, that pundit who was questioning, he put his head down and, ‘It make sense, no doubt.  But, how can he speak? Who taught him? There should be a parampara! There should be! He does not have any guru who taught him different bhaashyaas, commentaries, vaarthikaas, teekaas.  Then how can he comment on Upanishads?’
 
To that Swami, I gave only one answer: ‘Yes, I have not formally studied. The gurus who taught me don’t even know how to chant the mantras with the so-called perfection.  And they were not Sanskrit scholars. They taught me a little bit whatever they can.

LINK FOR FULL TRANSCRIPTS:- video/upanishad-live-forever-blissfully#gsc.tab=0
